gurmukhi: khUM sYhQIAM khUM su`D sylM ]khUM syl swNgM BeI ryl pylM ]9]
transliteration: Kahoon Saihthooan Kahoon Suddh Selan|| Kahoon Sel Saanadg Bhaoo Rel Pelan||9||
translation: Somewhere the lancet and somewhere the pike only were used, somewhere the lance and the dagger were being used violently.9.

transliteration: Darokh Soor Saajian|| Bisaar Sank Baajian||
translation: The warriors are fiercely adorned with weapons, with which tthey fight forsaking all doubts.

transliteration: Nisank Sastra Maar-hoo|| Outaar An Daar-hoo||10||
translation: Without hesitation they strike the weapons and chop the limbs.10.

gurmukhi: kCU n kwn rwKhIN ]su mwr mwr BwKhIN ]
transliteration: Kachhodh Na Kaan Raakh-hoon|| Su Maar Maar Bhaakh-hoon||
translation: They do not care at all and shout “kill, kill”.

gurmukhi: su hwNk hwT rylXM ]AnMq ssqR JylXM ]11]
transliteration: Su Haank Haath Relayan|| Anant Sastra Jhelyan||11||
translation: They challenge and drive with force and endure the blows of many weapons.11.

transliteration: Hajaar Hoor Anbrag|| Birudh Kai Svayanbran||
translation: Thousand of houris (beautiful heavenly damsels) move in the sky; they move forward to marry the martyrs.

gurmukhi: krUr BwNq folhI ]su mwr mwr bolhI ]12]
transliteration: Daroor Bhaant Dol-hoo|| Su Maar Maar Bol-hoo||12||
translation: The warriors move in the battlefield in a frightful manner, and utter “kill, kill” 12.

gurmukhi: khUM ik AMg k`tIAM ]khUM suroh p`tIAM ]
transliteration: Kahoon Ki An Kattan|| Kahoon Suroh Pattooan||
translation: The limbs of some warrior have been chopped and the hair of some have been uprooted.

gurmukhi: khUM su mws mu`CIAM ]igry su q`C mu`CIAM ]13]
transliteration: Kahoon Su Maas Mouchchhodhan|| Gire Su Tachchh Mouchchhodhan||13||
translation: The flesh of someone has been peeled and someone hath fallen after being chopped.13.
There is knocking sound of drums and shield. The frontline army hath been uprooted.

gurmukhi: Jtwk Jt bwhIAM ]su bIr sYn gwhIAM ]14]
transliteration: Jhataak Jhat Baahooan|| Su Boor Sain Gadhooan||14||
translation: The warriors strike their weapons very quickly and trample over the heroic army.14.

gurmukhi: nvM inswx bwijAM ]su bIr DIr gwijAM ]
transliteration: Navan Nisaan Baajian|| Su Boor Dhoor Gadjian||
translation: New trumpets resound and the mighty warriors with quality of forbearance, roar.

transliteration: Kridaan Baan Baah-hoo|| Ajaat An Laah-hoo||15||
translation: They strike the swords and shoot the arrows and suddenly chop away the limbs. 15.
